problems.title: Search for an Element in SLL
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL). Your task is to search for a given value X in the linked list. If the value is found, print its 1-based position. If not found, print -1.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the list).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.
The third line contains an integer X (value to search).

Output Format
Print the 1-based position of X if found, otherwise print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
30
Output: 3
problems.constraints:
1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements, X ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

problems.title: Count Nodes in SLL
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL). Your task is to count the total number of nodes in the linked list.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the list).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the total number of nodes.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
Output: 5
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

problems.title: Find the Middle Element of SLL
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL). Your task is to find the middle element of the linked list. If there are two middle elements (when N is even), print the second middle element.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the list).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the middle element. If the list is empty, print -1.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
Output: 30

Input:
6
10 20 30 40 50 60
Output: 40
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

problems.title: Reverse a Singly Linked List
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL). Your task is to reverse the linked list and display the elements of the reversed list.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the list).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print the elements of the reversed linked list separated by spaces.

Example
Input:
5
10 20 30 40 50
Output: 50 40 30 20 10
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(1)

problems.title: Check if SLL is a Palindrome
problems.description:
Problem Statement
You are given N integers to create a Singly Linked List (SLL). Your task is to check if the data in the linked list forms a palindrome. If it is a palindrome, print YES, otherwise print NO.

Input Format
The first line contains an integer N (size of the list).
The second line contains N space-separated integers.

Output Format
Print YES or NO.

Example
Input:
5
1 2 3 2 1
Output: YES
problems.constraints:
0 ≤ N ≤ 10^5
-10^9 ≤ Array elements ≤ 10^9
Time Complexity: O(N)
Space Complexity: O(N)
